mostLikely

public Engine.Prediction mostLikely(short[] sequence)
Generates the most likely state predictions for the sequence

Parameters:
sequence - The sequence for which to generate predictions
Returns:
A sequence on integers representing the most likely state for each position in the sequence.

mostLikely

public Engine.Prediction mostLikely(short[] sequence,
                                    Engine.LikelyNotifier notifier)
Generates the most likely state predictions for the sequence

Parameters:
sequence - The sequence for which to generate predictions
notifier - The notifier for progress indication
Returns:
A sequence on integers representing the most likely state for each position in the sequence.

mostLikely

                                    short[] result,
                                    Engine.LikelyNotifier notifier)
Generates the most likely state predictions for the sequence

Parameters:
sequence - The sequence for which to generate predictions
result - The array to use for the result.
Returns:
A sequence on integers representing the most likely state for each position in the sequence.

generateSequence

public short[][] generateSequence(int length)
Generates a sequence of rolls from the model with the states of used to emit each roll.

Parameters:
length - The length of the sequence to generate.
Returns:
A double array of integers where the first array is the sequence of rolls and the second array is the states used to generate the rolls.

forwards

public double[][] forwards(short[] sequence,
                           double[][] result)
Generates the forward algorithm to the end of the sequence.

Parameters:
sequence - The sequence upon which to base the calculations.
result - The result array to use. One will be allocated if null is passed.
Returns:
A double array of forward algorithm probabilities--one for each state and position. The first index is the state (one of STATE_D1 or STATE_D2) and the second is the position.

forwards

public double[][] forwards(short[] sequence,
                           double[][] result,
                           int limit)
Generates the forward algorithm to the end of the sequence.

Parameters:
sequence - The sequence upon which to base the calculations.
result - The result array to use. One will be allocated if null is passed.
limit - The position up to which the forward value should be calculated.
Returns:
A double array of forward algorithm probabilities--one for each state and position. The first index is the state (one of STATE_D1 or STATE_D2) and the second is the position.

backwards

public double[][] backwards(short[] sequence,
                            double[][] result)
Generates the backwards algorithm to the end of the sequence.

Parameters:
sequence - The sequence upon which to base the calculations.
result - The result array to use. One will be allocated if null is passed.
Returns:
A double array of backwards algorithm probabilities--one for each state and position. The first index is the state (one of STATE_D1 or STATE_D2) and the second is the position.

backwards

public double[][] backwards(short[] sequence,
                            double[][] result,
                            int limit)
Generates the backwards algorithm to the end of the sequence.

Parameters:
sequence - The sequence upon which to base the calculations.
result - The result array to use. One will be allocated if null is passed.
limit - The position up to which the backwards values will be calculated.
Returns:
A double array of backwards algorithm probabilities--one for each state and position. The first index is the state (one of STATE_D1 or STATE_D2) and the second is the position.

train

public void train(java.util.List sequences,
                  double delta,
                  int[][] pseudoCounts)
Trains the model one a set of sequences using the Baum-Welsch estimation method. The model will retain the new model parameters from the training.

Parameters:
sequences - A array of sequences to train upon.
delta - The delta change value at which the training will end.
pseudoCounts - Pseudo counts for the transitions
